newsitem.title: CHINA: Earthquake jolts northwest China region.
newsitem.headline: Earthquake jolts northwest China region.

text.p: An earthquake measuring 5.3 on the Richter scale jolted a county in China's northwestern Xinjiang region on Wednesday, but there were no immediate reports of casualties, the Xinhua news agency said.
The earthquake struck at 4.20 a.m. (2240 GMT) in Jiashi county, where up to 50 people were killed in an earthquake last month, Xinhua said.
Many local residents fled their homes after the tremor, but there were no immediate reports of casualties, it said.

An earthquake of 6.4 magnitude caused widespread damage and killed up to 50 people in Jiashi on January 21, and the area populated mainly by sheep herders and cotton farmers has since been rocked by hundreds of aftershocks.
